definition: (of a movie, show etc) to attract large audiences
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects

sentences.english: The movie Titanic is recording good in Guangming Cinema.
sentences.chinese: 影片《铁达尼号》在光明影片院十分卖座。

sentences.english: The play did not take in this city.
sentences.chinese: 那出戏在这个城市不卖座。

sentences.english: One of its foremost proponents is the country's most bankable director, Feng Xiaogang.
sentences.chinese: 其中最著名的拥护者是在中国最卖座的导演冯小刚。

sentences.english: For Jolie, one of the world's top box office stars, financial luck will be hers this year.
sentences.chinese: 全世界最卖座的女影星之一朱莉在兔年的财运就很旺。

sentences.english: To maintain the momentum if, next Monday may be just a declaration to break box-office in Taipei billion.
sentences.chinese: 若声势维持，可能下周一光是台北卖座即可宣告破亿。

sentences.english: The movie wfor continually being a flop. Nobody went to see it.
sentences.chinese: 学会美国十次了这部电影卖座率奇低，没有人去看。

sentences.english: The brass band still plays to packed houses.
sentences.chinese: 管乐队卖座率仍然很高。

sentences.english: She was up against the highest grossing film of all time, Avatar.
sentences.chinese: 她的对手是有史以来最卖座的影片《阿凡达》。

sentences.english: Whoever said that sex sells must not watch movies.
sentences.chinese: 那些说性爱戏卖座的人显然不怎么看电影。

definition: theater chain (abbr. for 電影院線|电影院线)
